newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR CLOSES WEAKER AGAINST HARD UNITS.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR CLOSES WEAKER AGAINST HARD UNITS.

text.p: The Zimbabwe dollar closed Wednesday trade weaker against hard currencies on the back of a surge in importer demand, dealers said.
"It was a pretty hectic day. We had some huge payments which meant there were only buyers in the market and no sellers whatsoever," one dealer said.
"It got to a situation where people closed shop and no-one wanted to trade anymore. Some people were even quoting wide spreads at the end of the day," he added.

The local unit finished the day at 10.6750/6950 against the U.S. currency, down from its 10.5600/5800 close on Tuesday and was also weaker againt pound sterling at 17.5200/5720 compared to 17.4390/4820.
Against South Africa's rand it closed at 2.2670/2750 from 2.2450/2530 and slipped to 7.0210/0390 from 6.9730/9890 versus the German mark.
